job.title: Vehicle Diagnostics Software Engineer
job.description: ltstronggtltugtAbout XosltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtltstronggtDescriptionltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtXos is an innovative electric vehicle company on a mission to decarbonize transportation Our zeroemission commercial vehicles and nextgeneration technologies empower fleets of Fortune 500 companies and positively impact our environment The market is growing The need is rising The time is nowltbrgtltbrgtAt Xos we design vehicles from scratch invent efficient and durable battery systems write software to control the vehicle and its interactions with the driver and entice fleet owners into an electrified future with groundbreaking serviceltbrgtltbrgtWe are a team of passionate doers that have banded together to do our part in the battle for a cleaner planet Were gogetters changemakers and futurecreators Will you join usltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtThe RoleltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtWe are looking for a vehicle diagnostics software engineer who will work on developing diagnostics software for fault management and service test communications based on industrystandard protocols J1939 J1708 for commercial vehicles This person will perform testing and validation of the software both on the bench HIL and in the vehicle and communicates crossfunctionally on design directions and requirements An ideal candidate will have confidence in his ability to contribute significantly and independently to the vehiclebuild as well as bring innovative ideas to the teamltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtRequirementsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtBS in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or related discipline MS preferredltligtltligt3 years of relevant experience in commercial vehicle diagnostics software development or testingltligtltligtKnowledge in control system theory and applicationsltligtltligtExperience in vehicular communication networks such as CAN CAN FD and LINltligtltligtUnderstanding of CAN bus messaging protocols such as J1939 and UDSltligtltligtExperience with MATLAB Simulink and StateflowltligtltligtProficient in embedded C code programmingltligtltligtFamiliar with measurement calibration and diagnostic tools such as ETAS INCA and Vector CANalyzerltligtltligtExperience with validation hardware and Hardwareintheloop HIL systems and test bench setupsltligtltligtFamiliar with version control tools such as Git or SVNltligtltligtExperience with change management tools such as JIRAltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtBenefitsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtXos Inc is committed to offering competitive wagesltligtltligtThe Company offers medical coverage paid 100 by the employer for employees with dependent coverage partially offset by the employerltligtltligtDental Vision and Life plans are also offered through the Companys health packageltligtltligtGenerous PTO sick vacation and holiday payltbrgtltligtltulgtltemgtXos Inc is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce We are an Equal OpportunityAffirmative Action Employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race color religion gender pregnancy sex sexual orientation gender identity
